intro: Merendera attica, commonly known as the Greek mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and fuzzy, woolly leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open areas such as roadsides and fields. Merendera attica is also valued for its medicinal properties, with historical use in traditional remedies.
